revised_title: Reflexion of Cylindrical Gravitational Waves by a Rigid Cylindrical Shell
tldr: The authors study the reflexion of cylindrical gravitational waves by a thin rigid cylindrical shell, considering it as a surface distribution. They show that if the shell is perfectly rigid, total reflexion occurs. Quasi-periodic incident waves lead to a completely periodic standing wave state between the reflector and a central wave-source, with the field outside the system remaining static.
